conclusion: To determine if Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), analyze the slopes of their velocity-time graphs.
The slope of a velocity-time graph represents acceleration.
For Object A, at \( t_1 \), the graph shows a decreasing slope (downward slope).
For Object B, at \( t_1 \), the graph shows an increasing slope (upward slope).
If the slopes of the velocity-time graphs for both objects are identical at \( t_1 \), then they have the same acceleration.
The slope of Object A is negative (decreasing velocity), while the slope of Object B is positive (increasing velocity).
Since the slopes are not the same (one is positive and one is negative), the objects do not have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
No, Object A and Object B do not have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
